datafield.subfield: Del bene de la vechiezza, Italian translation of De bono senectutis, made by Anchise Straccha of Bolzano (fl. 17th century) :
Use: Unrestricted, for either reading room or classroom use

Contents include:1. fol. ii-iv: letter of the translator to the reader, wrongly dated 1516 from Venice;2. fol. ix-xv: letter of the author to the Christian reader dated 1595 from Rome;3. fol. xvii-xxiv: preface;4. fol. xxv-xxxiii: tripartite index of chapters;5. pp. 1-678: Del bene de la vechiezza;6. pp. 679-686: list of saints who reached old age and prayers for use by the elderly.
Contemporary pagination for primary text (pp. 1-678), but preceded by 40 leaves.

MS 3327, Container 102: Offered by London booksellers McLeish & Sons, Catalogue 44, no. 2; acquired by Edward A. Parsons (1878-1962) of New Orleans, Louisiana, presumably in March 1929, his bookplate on the inside front cover and a pencil note on the rear flyleaf. Binding (Italy? late 19th c?): Full dark brown tanned goatskin over paper boards, understood to be an imitation of a style of 16th c Italian binding. Reverse caps, cut head edge, tight back over sewing supports. Gold-tooled single-line border, interlaced ribbons, acanthus leaves, etc., central cameo (Apollo in chariot), front and back covers; gold-tooled single lines across spine, small floral motifs in panels, no title. Sewn on two raised cords (third false raised band). Transverse spine linings with extensions adhered to inside of boards. Sewn endbands (indeterminate color) over parchment core, front bead. Endleaf components: front sewn outer-hook endleaf fold making folded stub, pastedown, one free endleaf; back same.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
